alert.note: Alert for Creek; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 05 at 4:21AM CDT until May 05 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Creek County in northeastern Oklahoma... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southern Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 630 AM CDT. * At 421 AM CDT, Emergency management and broadcast media reported extensive flooding ongoing across portions of Okfuskee, Okmulgee, and Muskogee counties. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen across much of the warned area with localized amounts near 10 inches. Additional rainfall amounts around one half inch are expected in the warned area early Thursday morning. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Avoid travel through the city of Okmulgee if possible. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Fort Gibson... Haskell... Morris... Beggs... Boley... Dewar... Okay... Porter... Schulter... Paden... Taft... Boynton... Grayson... Council Hill... Bearden... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Creek; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Wagoner
